title: U.S. tracked China spy balloon from launch on Hainan Island along unusual path
description: The errant path of the large Chinese spy balloon across Alaska and the continental United States may have been caused by unusual weather conditions that pulled it off course.

title: UK: Thief admits stealing thousands of chocolate Easter eggs
description: A man who British prosecutors say broke into an industrial park to steal almost 200,000 chocolate Easter eggs has pleaded guilty to theft and criminal damage

title: Four suspects arrested in Florida in assassination of Haitian president
description: Federal prosecutors detailed their account of how a group of men in South Florida allegedly developed, funded and directed a plot to assasinate the president.

title: Report: 8,468 perished trying to reach Europe since 2019
description: A global charity says more than 8,400 Europe-bound migrants perished at sea while attempting to cross the Mediterranean over the past four years

title: Man with explosives arrested outside Swiss parliament
description: Police in Switzerland’s capital say they have evacuated Parliament and related offices after a man in a bulletproof vest was arrested near one of its entrances and found to be bearing explosives

title: Egypt releases former anti-graft chief after serving 5 years
description: Egyptian authorities have released the country’s former anti-graft chief after he served a five-year prison term for allegedly insulting and disseminating false news about the military

title: Report alleges network of 're-education’ camps for Ukrainian children
description: Two camps in Crimea and Chechnya appear to subject children to military education, teaching them about firearms and military vehicles, researchers said.

title: Koh-i-noor diamond not part of King Charles III’s coronation
description: The Koh-i-noor diamond won’t be used during King Charles III’s coronation, allowing Buckingham Palace to sidestep the controversy surrounding a gem acquired during the age of Empire

title: US officials point to Russia using Iranian drones in Ukraine
description: American defense officials sought to dispel any doubt that Iran is supplying drones for Russia’s war in Ukraine, releasing photos and analysis of unmanned aircraft deployed in the conflict to demonstrate Tehran’s involvement

title: What is Transnistria, and will Russia destabilize Moldova?
description: Moldova's president accused Russia of plotting a coup against her government, renewing concerns over Moscow's meddling there and in separatist Transnistria.

title: Syria's Assad could reap rewards from aid crossing deal
description: A convoy of 11 trucks from a United Nations agency has crossed into northern Syria from Turkey — just hours after the U.N. and Syrian government reached an agreement to temporarily authorize two new border crossings into the rebel enclave

title: Queen Consort Camilla will wear a recycled crown, without cursed diamond
description: The news puts an end to speculation about whether the British royals might risk a diplomatic incident by flaunting a gem that India -- and others -- want back.

title: UN appeals for $397 million to help Syrian quake survivors
description: The United Nations chief has launched a $397 million appeal to help nearly 5 million survivors of last week’s devastating earthquake in rebel-held northwest Syria who have received very little assistance

title: These women journalists were doing their jobs. That made them targets.
description: Female reporters covering powerful people are often pushed out of their jobs as news organizations struggle to respond to smear campaigns meant to silence them

title: German ballet director issues apology over feces attack
description: A German ballet director has issued a public apology for smearing dog feces on the face of a newspaper critic whose reviews he had taken exception to

title: Taliban forces kill 3 IS members in raid on Kabul building
description: An official says Taliban intelligence forces killed three Islamic State group militants and arrested one other in an overnight operation in the Afghan capital of Kabul

title: At least 32 civilians killed in eastern Congo, says the U.N.
description: The United Nations says at least 32 civilians were killed by rebel groups in eastern Congo’s Ituri province

title: 5.7 magnitude earthquake rattles Romania, 2nd in 2 days
description: An earthquake with a magnitude of 5.7 rattled Romania, the second tremor of similar magnitude to shake the country in 24 hours

title: Polish mother of 7 successfully gives birth to quintuplets
description: Hospital officials in southern Poland say a Polish mother of seven has successfully given birth to premature quintuplets

title: Bus in northern South Africa crashes with van; 20 dead
description: A crash between a passenger bus and a van armored to carry cash in the northern province of Limpopo, South Africa has killed at least 20 people and injured 68, officials have reported

title: Zambia grants bail to 8 Croatians on trafficking charges
description: Eight Croatians facing charges of child trafficking have been granted bail of about $1,000 each by a court in Ndola in central Zambia

title: What to know about the deadly Marburg virus as new outbreak emerges
description: Closely related to Ebola, the Marburg virus has killed at least nine people in Equatorial Guinea. Its symptoms include severe hemorrhaging.

title: Israeli Cabinet minister rejects US criticism on settlements
description: Israel’s finance minister says that his ultranationalist party would push to legalize all wildcat settlement outposts in the occupied West Bank, a move likely to draw international outcry and condemnation

title: Dutch appeals court prohibits border police ethnic profiling
description: An appeals court has prohibited the Netherlands’ military police from using racial profiling as a way of selecting people for identity checks at borders

title: Why Israel’s planned overhaul of the judiciary is tearing the country apart
description: Netanyahu, who has legal troubles of his own, says the judicial reform will make the legal system more responsive to the majority. Opponents see the end of democracy.

title: Gunmen storm hospital of newborn saved from quake in Syria
description: A Syrian hospital official says gunmen stormed the clinic where a baby girl is receiving care after being born under her earthquake-shattered home

title: Pakistan nearly doubles gas prices to meet IMF bailout terms
description: Officials say Pakistan’s government nearly doubled tariffs on natural gas in an effort to comply with a long-stalled bailout by the International Monetary Fund

title: NATO chief unfazed about Finland, Sweden joining together
description: NATO Secretary-General Jens Stoltenberg is playing down the importance of Finland and Sweden joining the world’s biggest security organization at the same time

title: Russia denies claims it plans to destabilize Moldova
description: Russia has angrily rejected the Moldovan president’s claim about an alleged plot by Moscow to overthrow her government, accusing Moldova’s authorities of trying to distract public attention from the country’s own domestic problems

title: Qatar donates World Cup mobile homes to earthquake survivors
description: Qatar plans to send 10,000 cabins and caravans from last year’s World Cup to provide shelter for survivors of the Turkish earthquakes

title: Germany to produce ammo for air defense guns sent to Ukraine
description: Germany’s defense minister says a deal has been signed for new ammunition for self-propelled anti-aircraft guns it provided to Ukraine to be produced at home after it ran into difficulties securing supplies from elsewhere

title: Sweden's king to undergo planned surgery in heart area
description: Sweden’s King Carl XVI Gustaf will undergo a planned a surgical procedure through peephole surgery in the heart area

title: Palestinian teen killed in Israeli army raid in West Bank
description: Palestinians say a Palestinian teen was killed during an Israeli army raid in a refugee camp in the northern West Bank

title: North Korea’s ‘first daughter’: Everything we know about Kim Ju Ae
description: North Korean leader Kim Jong Un seems to be promoting his daughter as heir apparent. We don't know much about the girl, but this is what we've gleaned so far.

title: Ukraine seeks warplanes at NATO talks, allies fret over ammo
description: Ukraine is keeping up its appeal for Western countries to provide it with fighter jets

title: Venezuela claims nearly three quarters of Guyana. Guyana wants help.
description: A huge oil discovery and social media are reviving a centuries-old border dispute.

title: Tunisian Islamist leader arrested in crackdown on opposition
description: Lawyers say that Tunisian authorities have arrested the leader of the Ennahda opposition Islamist movement in a crackdown on rival politicians and critics of the North African country’s increasingly authoritarian president Kais Saied

title: New Zealand declares rare state of emergency as cyclone wreaks havoc
description: Cyclone Gabrielle "comes hot on the heels of other extreme weather events," the prime minister said. Experts warned that the effects of climate change will worsen.

title: Indian government raids BBC offices after documentary critical of leader
description: The raids took place in New Delhi less than a month after the Modi government took extraordinary measures to censor a BBC documentary deemed critical of the prime minister.

title: Turkey-Syria quake briefing: Assad agrees to open more border crossings for aid to Syria, U.N. says
description: The move by Syrian President Bashar al-Assad would allow more aid to enter the country’s rebel-held northwest, U.N. Secretary General António Guterres said.

title: Hackers target Bahrain airport website to mark uprising
description: Hackers say they have taken down the website of Bahrain’s international airport to mark the 12-year anniversary of an Arab Spring uprising in the small Gulf country

title: Ukraine live briefing: Moldova alleges Russian coup plot; U.S. hosting Ukraine defense meeting in Brussels
description: Russia sought to install a pro-Kremlin administration in Moldova, President Maia Sandu said, citing intelligence provided by Kyiv.

title: Love blossoms in Serbia between Ukrainian, Russian 'enemies'
description: She is Ukrainian, he is Russian

title: Amid quake's devastation, parallel rescue bid targets pets
description: Six days after the earthquake that flattened parts of Turkey and Syria, two survivors emerged from the rubble

title: Rescuers find more alive in Turkey on 8th day after quake
description: Rescuers on Tuesday were working to reach people under the rubble in three provinces hit hard by the powerful and devastating quake that hit Turkey and Syria last week

title: For Syrian women, quake adds disaster on top of war's pain
description: Syrian women have shouldered the responsibility of keeping families together during a dozen years of civil war — and now, in the devastating aftermath of an earthquake

title: Some Ukrainian soldiers freeze sperm amid war with Russia
description: As Vitalii Khroniuk lay facedown on the ground taking cover from Russian artillery fire, the Ukrainian soldier had just one regret

title: Idris Elba on James Bond: 'I'm not going to be that guy'
description: Actor Idris Elba says he’s going to stick with being the tormented detective John Luther — not James Bond

title: Kenya seeks divine help to end crippling, ongoing drought
description: With the prospect of a sixth consecutive failed rainy season in the east and Horn of Africa, Kenya’s president is hoping the heavens will finally open with the help of a national day of mass prayer on Tuesday
